structures.label: fol. 006v-007r: 6v: KL for December. Occupation of slaughtering, and Capricorn.7r: Whole-page miniature. The Gospel writers, preceding Pericopes: St. John with his...

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: 6v: KL for December. Occupation of slaughtering, and Capricorn.7r: Whole-page miniature. The Gospel writers, preceding Pericopes: St. John with his eagle on Patmos, St. Matthew with his angel, St. Mark with his lion and St. Luke with his ox, all seen through arches in a two-tiered architectural frame with winged putti playing about; two putti blowing two trumpets at a time.

metadata.label: Image Range
metadata.value: fol. 016r

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: The Annunciation, preceding Hours of the Virgin. The angel Gabriel and the Virgin in an interior with screens, and the inscription âGracia ple(na)â on the lintel. The Virgin is seated with an open book on her lap. Frame with lion masks, putti on top playing with strings of beads and on either side their ends are treated as bell-pulls by two other putti. Below, a mock fight with swords and shields, and a winged putti in the middle.

structures.label: fol. 022r: Joachim and Anne meeting at the Golden Gate, preceding Office of the Virgin, Lauds. Their embrace is symbolic of St. Anneâs immaculate conception...

metadata.label: Image Range
metadata.value: fol. 022r

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Joachim and Anne meeting at the Golden Gate, preceding Office of the Virgin, Lauds. Their embrace is symbolic of St. Anneâs immaculate conception of the Virgin. Joachim is richly dressed with a collar of ermine. The Visitation in a landscape with turreted town and a windmill on the hill, below, in the predella of this altarpiece-like frame. Putti drape strings of coral beads as on fols. 15v-16r; below, one clutches a shield.

metadata.value: The Crucifixion, preceding Office of the Cross, Matins. Christ between the two thieves (the good thief looking up), the Virgin is supported by St. John and a Mary; Mary Magdalene is embracing the foot of the Cross, her pot of ointment on the ground. Three soldiers on horseback, with army behind. Starry sky with sun and moon above, town in landscape beyond. Frame with ogee arch. Putti hold strings of coral beads at top; below, three putti dice for Christâs garments.

metadata.value: 28v Text-page with borders on two sides of flowers, grapes and white acanthus leaf scrolls. 29r Whole-page miniature. The Pentecost, preceding Office of the Holy Ghost, Matins. In a classical interior, the Virgin is kneeling in prayer by an altar with an open book in a congregation of praying men and women; the Dove below blue baldakin. Architectural frame, with lion mask at the top, and a putto with a portative organ below.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: The Pentecost, preceding Office of the Holy Ghost, Matins.  The Virgin by an altar with an open book, in a congregation of the twelve apostles and three women, all at prayer. The white dove of the Holy Spirit emanating light from below the baldachin at the back. Inscription on lintel. Frame with lion mask and putti at the top and sides; one putto plays a portative organ below.

metadata.label: Image Range
metadata.value: fol. 030r

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: The Adoration of the Child, preceding Office of the Virgin, Prime. The Virgin kneels on the ground adoring the Child lying on a corner of her mantle. The Child emanates light all around. Joseph holds a candle shielding the flame with his hand, his hat on the ground. Angel and light from above. Ox and ass near. From outside the wall, three shepherds watching, one with a flute doffs his hat. The stable is simple, but not a ruin; a cloth of brocade is shielding the back. Putti with four cornucopia at top of frame; below, displaying joy.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Adoration of the Magi, preceding Office of the Virgin, Sext. Virgin with Child sitting on her lap, Joseph behind, doffs his hat. Older king kneels and offers chalice to the Child; the other two kings behind, one in middle years and one black with a white ermine crowned hat, both with gifts. Landscape seen through opening in stable, a moated castle or city wall with crenellated towers. Putti on top of frame; below, two putti play at crowning the third.

The Presentation in the Temple, preceding Office of the Virgin, None. The Child lies on a draped altar; Simeon stands behind with his arms crossed. The Virgin kneels at the front, on the side, Joseph holds the basket with three doves, next two young women, one holds a lit candle. A hilly landscape with castles seen through colonnade. On top of frame, two putti aim at each other with bow and arrow.

metadata.value: fol. 038r

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Presentation in the Temple, preceding Office of the Virgin, None. Child lies on draped altar; Simeon dressed as the high priest, stands behind with his arms crossed. The Virgin kneels at the front; behind, Joseph holds basket with the three doves, brought according to tradition as offering for the âpurificationâ of the mother. Two young women, one holds a tall lit candle, alluding to the Feast of the Purification incorporating a procession of candles. Open curtain behind Simeon. Landscape seen through open collonade at back. Frame with two putti at the top, aiming at each other with bow and arrow.

metadata.value: 44v Text-page with surround border on blue, stippled gold, ground: left, a candelabra with mask, fishes, coral beads, etc.; lower border, two snails with their shells and two crocodiles.45r Whole-page miniature in architectural frame of David and Bathsheba, preceding Penitential Psalms. In a castle garden, Bathsheba stands in a pool of carved rose coloured stone, she is attended by two women servants, one with a towel and a mirror and one with a salver of figs from which Bathsheba has just helped herself. Watching her from a castle window, which is hung with an arras (carpet), David with crown and sceptre, and wearing an ermine collar. On the frame, two putti above, and two armed men below the picture.

metadata.label: Image Range
metadata.value: fol. 045r

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: David and Bathsheba, preceding Penitential Psalms. In a castle garden, Bathsheba stands in a pool of carved rose-coloured stone, attended by two women servants, one with a towel and a mirror and one with a salver of figs from which Bathsheba has just helped herself. Watching her from a castle window, which is hung with an arras (carpet), David with crown and sceptre, wearing ermine-lined crown, sleeves and collar. On the frame, two putti above; below, an armoured man wears a horned helmet (the cuckolded Uriah) carrying a sponge on a stick, and the other aiming at him with a sling (David).

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: PietÃ  or Lamentation, preceding Stabat Mater. Mary with the body of Christ across her knees. His head, with a crown of (green) thorns, is supported by Mary Cleophas. At his feet, Mary Magdalene with her pot of ointment. In the background, the two crosses with the thieves. Castle town in hilly landscape with river. Putti fighting with swords and shields.

structures.label: fol. 070v-071r: 70v Whole-page miniature. PietÃ  or Lamentation, preceding Stabat Mater. Mary with the body of Christ across her knees, at the foot of the empty...

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: 70v Whole-page miniature. PietÃ  or Lamentation, preceding Stabat Mater. Mary with the body of Christ across her knees, at the foot of the empty cross (a Tau cross with label inscribed INRI). His head with a crown of green thorns, is supported by Mary Cleophas. At his feet, Mary Magdalene with her pot of ointment. In the background, also the two crosses with the thieves. Castle town on hilly landscape. On the architectural frame, columns with inset polished shafts of red and green marble, putti supporting strings of coral beads from top; below, two putti having a mock fight with swords and shields.71r text-page with initial S(tabat mater); surround border of flowers, fruit, crocodile(?), bird and leaf scroll motifs.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: 76v Text-page with side border of flowers and fruit in a diamond trellis design.77r Whole-page miniature. Virgin and Child enthroned, with owners and their patron saints, preceding Prayer to St. John the Baptist. The young man is presented by St. John the Baptist who holds a book with Agnus Dei on its cover; the woman in a black cap is presented by St. Margaret of Antioch, accompanied by her dragon. Arms of owners presented by putti in the lower part of the architectural frame: âgules three roses argent and the same impaling azure three six pointed stars or in chief a cross formy orâ. Putti with coral beads at top, inset marble shafts in columns. Hilly landscape seen through the open collonade.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Virgin and Child enthroned, with owners and their patron saints, preceding Prayer to St. John the Baptist. The man is presented to the Virgin and Child by St. John the Baptist who holds a book with Agnus Dei sitting on top of its cover; the woman in a black cap is presented by St. Margaret of Antioch who is accompanied by her dragon. Arms of owners are presented by the putti in the lower part of the architectural frame: âgules three roses argent and the same impaling azure three six pointed stars or in chief a cross formy orâ. Putti with coral beads at top, inset marble shafts in columns. Hilly landscape seen through the open colonade.
